result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Payment of $100 fine + costs + fees + DNA Surcharge= Payment to be worked out with agent.
No possession or consumption of alcohol or any controlled substance without a valid Rx. No contact with the victim without prior agent approval.

Maintain/obtain full time employment. Any assessments, counseling and follow through as recommended by agent. Take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed. DNA Sample Due: September 13, 2022. Payment of restitution if claim is made. Bond to be applied to Atty for any Dean fees- if there is a balance, balance to be applied to any of the remaining fines, costs, fees, and/or DNA Surcharge.

10:26 AM Prosecuting attorney DeShea D. Morrow in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Megan S. McKenney in court.  Attorney William Reabe in court for Megan S. McKenney. 
Court calls cases 22CF20 and 22CM6. 
Atty spks- case has been resolved. 
Atty provides plea form.
Atty provides Deferred Judgment Agreement. 
DA heard on agreement.
Atty agrees.
DA reads charge on Count 1 in 22CF20.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea.
DA reads charge on Count 2 in 22CF20.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea. 
DA reads charge on Count 3 in 22CF20.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea.
DA reads charge on Count 1 in 22CM6.
Court arraigns Deft.
Deft enters Guilty Plea. 
Non-citizen advisory.
Elements of offense.
PleaQuest/WOR.
Constitutional rights.
Deft understands.
Atty satisfied.
Factual basis.
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea on Count 1 in 22CF20, but withholds findings of guilt pursuant to the Deferred Judgment Agreement. 
Court finds Deft enters plea freely, voluntarily and intelligently; therefore court accepts plea and finds deft guilty on Count 2 and Count 3 in 22CF20 and Count 1 in 22CM6. 
DA heard on sentencing.
Atty heard on sentencing.
Deft heard.
Court heard on factors.
Court withholds sentence on Count 2 in 22CF20, and places deft on probation for 2 years. 
Conditions of Probation: 
90 days conditional jail time, without good time but with huber if in compliance with jail rules and regulations. 
Deft to report to the MCJ no later than 7pm on September 13, 2022. 
Credit for 8 days time served.

Take all prescribed medications and only as prescribed.

11:35 AM Defendant Megan S. McKenney in court with attorney Bradley J. Schraven.  Defendant Megan S. McKenney in custody.  Kathryn E Heineck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Megan S. McKenney appeared by video means.
Court calls case.
Atty Schraven is present for bond purposes only.
Copy of Criminal Complaint.
Court reviews charges and maximum penalties.
DA heard on bond recommendations.

Deft heard.
Court imposes $1000 cash bail w/ conditions;  sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances, including THC, w/o a valid Rx, no contact by any means with J.W. 
Deft to contact the Public Defenders office today.
